turtleGraphics.turtle

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • turtleGraphics.turtle.Turtle

  • public class Turtle
extends java.lang.Object
    A system for drawing vector graphics using relative positioning. A turtle lives on a plane, has a position and a direction, and draws as it moves. The original turtles were physical robots which used an actual pen on actual paper! This class mimics the behavior of that physical system in software.

    You can control the turtle with the forward(), backward(), left() and right() messages, which move the turtle relative to its current state. (Turtle presentation mechanisms may choose to animate these transitions.) You can also instantly change the turtle's state using setter methods such as setX(); these methods work in absolute coordinates.

    The turtle has a pen state, which includes a color and stroke width. The pen can also be up or down; when it is up, the turtle moves without drawing.

    In addition to using a relative system of position and direction, the turtle uses a relative system of distance: the forward() and backward() work relative to the current step size. If you only change the step size using scaleStepBy() (and not the absolute setter setStepSize(), you can easily rescale an entire turtle program by changing the initial step size.

    See Also:
    Wikipedia: Turtle graphics, Wikipedia: Turtle robot

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Turtle(double x, double y)
      Creates a turtle with a black pen at the given initial position.
      Turtle(double x, double y, java.awt.Color color)
      Creates a turtle at the given initial position with a pen of the given color.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addObserver(TurtleObserver observer)
      Adds an observer to be notified of this turtle's motions (typically for the purpose of drawing them to paper).
      void backward()
      Moves the turtle backward one step.
      void backward(double steps)
      Moves the turtle backward by an arbitrary multiplier of the current step size.
      void forward()
      Moves the turtle forward one step.

      double getX() 
      double getY() 
      boolean isPenDown() 
      void left(double degrees)
      Turns the turtle to its left (counterclockwise when viewed from above) by the given number of degrees.
      void penDown()
      Puts the pen down on the virtual paper, so that subsequent motions leave pixel ink behind.
      void penUp()
      Lifts the pen from the virtual paper, so that subsequent motions do not draw anything.
      void removeObserver(TurtleObserver observer)
      Removes the given observer.
      void right(double degrees)
      Turns the turtle to its right (clockwise when viewed from above) by the given number of degrees.

      Multiplies the current step size by the given multiplier.

    • Method Detail

      • forward

        public void forward()
        Moves the turtle forward one step. Draws a line segment if the pen is down.

      • forward

        public void forward(double steps)
        Moves the turtle forward by an arbitrary multiplier of the current step size. Draws a line segment if the pen is down.

      • backward

        Moves the turtle backward one step. Draws a line segment if the pen is down.
